intro: Crepis leiocarpa, commonly known as the pale-hair grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Crepis leiocarpa is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions.
